比利时药品监管机构表示，他们查获了假冒的索马鲁肽，索马鲁肽是诺和诺德(NOVOb.CO)流行的肥胖药物 Wegovy 的活性成分，注射笔中含有胰岛素。

联邦药品和保健品局告诉路透社，今年它扣留了九个邮寄的 GLP-1 药物包裹，此类药物包括 Wegovy 和 Novo 的糖尿病药物 Ozempic，怀疑它们是假的。

据称，其中两个包裹被发现含有并非由诺和诺德或另一家 GLP-1 制药商生产的药物。

该机构称，一项实验室分析证实其中含有胰岛素，这种药物用于治疗糖尿病，如果服用不当，可能会导致严重的健康问题，例如低血糖（危险的低血糖）和癫痫发作。

奥地利卫生监管机构上周报告称，奥地利有数人因使用疑似假冒 Ozempic 住院治疗。

该国健康安全监管机构 BASG 表示，患者出现了副作用，表明该产品含有胰岛素而不是索马鲁肽，但没有透露这一点是否已通过测试得到证实。

英国周四警告公众，不要购买自称是 Ozempic 或诺和诺德老牌减肥药 Saxenda 的假减肥笔，此前有报道称，有“极少数”住院治疗。

对 Ozempic 和其他减肥药物的需求激增，导致这些药物短缺，假货大量出现。

澳大利亚卫生监管机构治疗产品管理局发言人表示，该机构今年已发现 14 起假冒减肥药案件。

比利时卫生部长上周表示，该国希望在几周或几个月内暂时禁止使用 Ozempic作为减肥治疗药物，以解决该药物的短缺问题，该药物被批准用于治疗 2 型糖尿病，这是 GLP 的最初用途-1 药物。

执法、反假冒和公共卫生官员表示，他们正在对假药投诉展开调查，在电子商务和社交媒体上搜索购买优惠或广告，并对海关官员进行如何识别假药的培训，以帮助遏制假药激增。

以色列总理本雅明·内塔尼亚胡谴责哈马斯周一发布的一段视频是“残酷的心理宣传”，该视频显示三名人质于 10 月 7 日被伊斯兰运动扣押。

视频显示，三名妇女——内塔尼亚胡确认为叶莲娜·特鲁帕诺布、丹妮尔·阿洛尼和里蒙·基尔什特——并排坐在光秃秃的墙上，阿洛尼向总理发表了愤怒的信息。

她指责内塔尼亚胡在哈马斯致命袭击中未能保护以色列公民，也未能让他们回家，她呼吁达成协议，以释放巴勒斯坦囚犯来换取他们的释放。

“你们本应解放我们所有人。你们承诺解放我们所有人。但我们却承受着你们政治、安全、军事、外交上的失败，”她说。

内塔尼亚胡在一份声明中重申，将尽一切努力将人质带回家。

他说：“你们被犯下战争罪行的哈马斯绑架了，我拥抱你们。我们的心与你们和其他俘虏同在。我们正在尽一切努力将所有俘虏和失踪人员带回家。”

阿洛尼的父亲拉莫斯·阿洛尼说，当他在视频中看到女儿时，他的心脏几乎停止跳动，感到震惊，但也因为她还活着而松了口气。

“直到今天我们还不知道有关她的任何确认信息，”他告诉聚集在特拉维夫的记者。

他说，阿洛尼和他家人的其他五人一起被关押，其中包括 3 岁的双胞胎孙子。

阿维塔尔·基尔希特（Avital Kirscht）的女儿里蒙（Rimon）在视频中静静地坐在阿洛尼（Aloni）旁边，她表示，他们将尽一切努力将她带回家，并要求人质接受紧急医疗护理。

“我不希望任何母亲都经历我们过去 24 天所经历的事情，”她说。 “我今天看到了视频，我很担心。Rimon 没有戴眼镜。她已经有 24 天看不见东西了。她需要戴眼镜。”

这段短视频是哈马斯发布的第二条人质信息，此前该视频于 10 月 17 日发布了一段关于 21 岁法国裔以色列妇女米娅· 谢姆 (Mia Schem)的视频。

加沙人质的存在使以色列军队上周在该飞地展开的地面行动变得更加复杂，巴勒斯坦当局称，这场猛烈的空袭已造成 8000 多人死亡。

到目前为止，已有四名人质获释，但在地面行动开始后，通过卡塔尔协调的秘密渠道努力确保更多人质获释的努力似乎已被搁置。

路透社咨询的军事专家表示，以色列军队在加沙的地面攻势进展缓慢，部分原因是为了保持吸引哈马斯武装分子就释放 200 多名人质进行谈判的可能性。

以色列军队在持续地面入侵加沙的头几天，相对谨慎地占领并保护了部分领土，这与过去三周对地中海飞地的无情空袭以及以色列之前在那里的地面攻势形成了鲜明对比。 。

根据三名专家的评估，以色列地面部队不直接进入加沙最密集的地区，目的是通过长期攻势削弱哈马斯的领导地位，同时为就被扣押的人质问题达成可能的协议留出空间。以色列安全消息来源。

总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡上周表示，解救人质是加沙军方目标的“组成部分”。统治加沙的伊斯兰武装组织哈马斯迄今为止已释放了据信被关押的 239 名平民中的 4 名， 其中许多人被关押在深深的地道网络中。

军方周一表示，在加沙地面行动中，部队将一名被哈马斯囚禁的以色列士兵解救出来。

一位拒绝接受这一计划的前高级指挥官表示，通过缓慢行动，军队还希望确保以色列军队的侧翼安全，并引诱哈马斯武装人员从隧道或人口密集的城市地区出来，在开阔地区与以色列军队交战，因为这样他们更容易被杀死。被命名。

以色列军方发言人以该问题的敏感性为由，拒绝就此次进攻的细节发表评论。

以色列前国防情报局局长阿莫斯·亚德林对记者说：“我们一寸一寸、一米一米地行动，试图避免人员伤亡，并尽可能多地杀死哈马斯恐怖分子。”

10 月 7 日，哈马斯武装分子闯入以色列，造成 1,400 人死亡，其中大部分是平民，这是该国 75 年历史上死亡人数最多的一天，这促使以色列做出了强烈反应。以色列称，239 人被扣为人质进入加沙，据信他们被关押在哈马斯广泛的隧道网络中。

据哈马斯控制的加沙卫生部称，哈马斯袭击后三周内，以色列空袭摧毁了加沙大片地区，造成 8,000 多人死亡，其中包括 3,000 多名儿童，并切断了食品、药品和燃料的供应。

哈马斯领导人表示，需要停火才能释放平民人质，以色列称这些人质包括持有来自 25 个不同国家护照的人质。

2011年，哈马斯通过谈判释放了以色列境内的1000多名巴勒斯坦囚犯，以换取一名以色列士兵。

国际社会对加沙局势的担忧日益加剧，上周主要大国呼吁以色列允许“人道主义暂停”，以运送援助物资和解救人质。以色列拒绝了这些呼吁，称任何停战都会对哈马斯有利，这是自 10 月 7 日以来以色列与其盟友之间的首次公开分歧。

周六，现任内塔尼亚胡战时内阁成员的前国防部长本尼·甘茨表示，“在这场战争中，没有外交时钟”。

国防部长约夫·加兰特表示，战争将是漫长的，以色列正在“从空中、陆地和海上”打击哈马斯。

内塔尼亚胡周六没有将地面入侵称为全面入侵。

包围加沙城

以色列在与加沙边境集结了包括预备役军人在内的数十万士兵后，于周五进行了首次持续的地面进攻。

首席发言人丹尼尔·哈加里少将表示，政府给以色列军方设定了两个目标——瓦解哈马斯，包括其基础设施和行动能力，以及将人质带回家。

在直升机和无人机的支援下，坦克和装甲运兵车已开进飞地主要城市中心加沙城以北的半农村地区。

当地居民和哈马斯下属的 Shehab 通讯社周一表示，部队还进入该市南部，威胁到贯穿 40 公里长地带的主要交通干道 Salah Al Deen 路。

据武装分子和居民称，坦克在路上遇到了阻力。以色列军方表示不会详细说明其部队的位置。

与哈马斯结盟的规模较小的激进组织伊斯兰圣战组织的高级发言人阿布·艾哈迈德表示，以色列军队除了推进到开放地区外，未能取得任何持续突破。

哈加里说，更多由炮兵和战斗工兵支援的步兵和装甲部队已被派往，并在地面上进行机动，与哈马斯武装分子交战。他拒绝证实任何部队地点。

他在周一的例行简报中表示：“进攻活动将根据战争的阶段及其目标坚定地继续并加强。”

隧道危险

安全消息来源将哈马斯的加沙隧道深层网络描述为一座地下城市，其中包括火箭发射场、指挥中心和针对以色列军队的攻击路径。

特种作战旅预备役少校奥姆里·阿塔尔(Omri Attar)表示，地面部队还接受了寻找通往隧道开口的通风口和逃生舱口以及在里面放置炸药将其密封的训练。他说，作战工程兵团内的其他特种部队过去使用机器人和狗，将处理隧道内的任何战斗。

他说：“这是一个非常复杂的情况，我不是在谈论死亡人数或被绑架人数，而是下城的基础设施、隧道的情况是一个非常微妙的情况。”

10 月 29 日，在埃雷兹过境点附近行动的以色列部队“发现了一些从加沙地带隧道井道出来的恐怖分子”。

以色列军方表示：“确认身份后，士兵们与恐怖分子对峙，打死打伤他们。”

迄今为止，这种做法与之前对加沙的进攻有所不同，加沙地带主要是城市地带，居住着230万人口，曾在2008年、2014年和2021年遭受以色列针对哈马斯和伊斯兰圣战组织的袭击，哈马斯和伊斯兰圣战组织发誓要摧毁以色列。

2008年，以色列军队大规模进入建筑区，促使哈马斯定期撤退和交战。

以色列军队意识到加沙密集地区的危险以及派遣大量部队的危险。

2008 年，以色列在入侵过程中损失了 9 名士兵，这凸显了风险。 2014年，死亡人数飙升至66人。

以色列军方公布的最新数据显示，自10月7日以来，已有315名以色列士兵丧生，其中大部分是在哈马斯最初的袭击中丧生。

本·米尔奇 (Ben Milch) 曾于 2014 年担任战斗工程兵团指挥官，负责摧毁隧道，他表示，当时他们的任务不是进入网络超过两公里。

“我们只需摧毁数十条隧道，今天的挑战将是数百条隧道和数公里，以及哈马斯建造的真正的地下堡垒，”他告诉路透社。

清理隧道还面临其他困难，包括扣押人质以及决定是否关闭通风井。

“在我看来，这就是为什么以色列国防军（以色列军队）正在采取有条不紊、较慢的方法，以确保他们覆盖所有基地，并确保他们在前进过程中消除隧道，这样他们就不会从后面、侧面等等遭到伏击，”米尔奇说。

“我们不想失去士兵，所以我们会放慢脚步，确保尽可能减少伤亡。”

目击者称，以色列装甲部队周一从两个方向袭击了加沙北部主要城市，并瞄准了连接加沙与飞地南部的主要道路，扩大了攻势，导致国际社会呼吁更多人保护加沙平民。

以色列军方表示，过去几天，随着扩大在加沙地带的地面行动，他们袭击了600多个武装目标。随着战争进入第四周，那里的巴勒斯坦平民迫切需要燃料、食物和清洁水。

自三周前以色列-哈马斯战争爆发以来，只有几十辆人道主义援助卡车抵达了被围困的 230 万人的飞地，随着人们冲进联合国仓库寻找食物，社会秩序已经崩溃。

联合国巴勒斯坦难民机构（UNRWA）周一表示，这导致四个联合国援助物资分发中心和一个储存设施无法运作。

世界卫生组织地区紧急事务负责人里克·布伦南对路透社表示：“这是一场灾难之上的灾难。卫生需求正在飙升，而我们满足这些需求的能力正在迅速下降。”他重申国际社会呼吁停火，以开展更大规模的人道主义行动。

以色列再次警告平民从加沙北部转移到南部，并于周五晚些时候开始进攻，追捕据称藏身于加沙城地下迷宫般的隧道中的哈马斯武装分子。

许多巴勒斯坦人留在原地，因为担心像 前几代人一样无家可归，并对以色列对南部地区的空袭感到震惊。

法迪住在加沙城北郊的贾巴利亚难民营，他拒绝透露自己的姓氏。他说，该地区现在正处于以色列地面进攻的致命危险之中，坦克在其边缘隆隆作响。但他发誓不会逃跑。

Russians came in dribs and drabs to lay flowers on Monday to the victims of Soviet dictator Joseph Stalin's purges, on an official day of remembrance largely shunned by an establishment keen to blank out reminders of Russia's troubled past.

Natalia Anafonova came to St Petersburg's Levashov Cemetery to honour her great-grandfather.

"It was a tragedy for our family," she says. "Our (great-)grandmother, when her husband was shot, was left alone with four children. She was expelled to Uglich (about 740km from St Petersburg).

"He was shot in Moscow, but as we all live in St. Petersburg, we have made this memorial plaque here. So that we could come here, to honour his memory and remember him forever."

It is not an attitude shared by the Russian president, who has sought to suppress attempts to evaluate Stalin critically.

Vladimir Putin has instead praised Stalin for saving the Soviet Union from Nazi invaders, and tried to channel that heroic spirit as his own forces seize parts of Ukraine in a war that he casts as a struggle against alleged Western attempts to destroy Russia.

Yet for many Russians, Stalin's name still evokes the savage repression that culminated in the Great Terror of 1936-1938.

The purge is estimated by historians to have killed between 700,000 and 1.2 million real or imagined enemies or rivals - from fellow Communists to military officers, intellectuals, professionals and peasants.

Zinaida Gerchikova said the day was sacred to her because she knew nothing about her father. "In fact, I only saw him once, when he picked me up from the maternity hospital," she said.

"They don't know where he was shot. Somewhere in Sverdlovsk region. I've been given some tips at the Big House," Gerchikova said. The Big House is the nickname of the St Petersburg headquarters of Stalin's NKVD secret police, which later became that of the Soviet KGB and now the Russian FSB.

"I've made inquiries, but to no avail. But I need to remember my father."

It was to help people like Gerchikova that the Nobel Peace Prize-winning human rights group Memorial International was founded as the Soviet Union collapsed - to document Soviet political repression and help to rehabilitate its victims.

But the group was banned in Russia in 2021 and officially dissolved under a decades-long campaign to silence political dissent.

"I think some very bad things are happening in our society," said Sergei Gorshvo, contemplating Stalin's purges as he paid his respects at the cemetery.

"They're making clear to us that all that may come back. And that's the scariest thing."

Maria Julia Assis was sitting down to a meal in her terraced home in north London when her 6-year-old son ran into the dining room, his face pale.

他的安卓手机上的益智游戏被一段视频打断，视频显示哈马斯武装分子、惊恐的以色列家庭和模糊的画面。黑屏上，一条来自以色列外交部的信息告诉一年级学生：“我们将确保那些伤害我们的人付出沉重的代价。”

Assis, a 28-year-old barista from Brazil, said that the ad left her son shaken and she quickly deleted the game.

“他很震惊，”她上周在电话采访中说。 “他字面意思是，‘这个该死的广告在我的游戏中做了什么？’”

路透社尚未确定该广告是如何出现在她儿子的视频游戏中的，但她的家人并不孤单。该通讯社还记录了欧洲各地至少另外五起案件，其中向游戏玩家（包括几名儿童）播放了同样的亲以色列视频，其中包含火箭袭击、猛烈爆炸和蒙面枪手的镜头。

至少在一个案例中，这些广告是在世嘉旗下开发商 Rovio (ROVIO.HE)制作的流行“愤怒的小鸟”游戏中播放的。

Rovio 证实，“不知何故，这些含有令人不安内容的广告错误地进入了我们的游戏”，现在已被手动屏蔽。发言人洛塔·贝克兰德(Lotta Backlund)没有提供有关其“十几个广告合作伙伴”中哪一个向其提供广告的详细信息。

以色列外交部数字部门负责人大卫·萨兰加证实，该视频是政府宣传的广告，但表示他“不知道”它是如何出现在各种游戏中的。

他表示，这段视频是以色列外交部更大规模宣传活动的一部分，自哈马斯 10 月 7 日袭击以色列南部平民并引发加沙战争以来，以色列外交部已花费 150 万美元用于互联网广告。他说，官员们已明确指示广告商“禁止 18 岁以下的人观看”。

萨兰加为广告活动的图形性质进行了辩护。

“我们希望世界了解以色列发生的事情，”他说。 “这是一场屠杀。”

路透社联系了 Rovio 在其网站上列为“第三方数据合作伙伴”的 43 家广告公司，试图确定是谁在游戏中投放了广告。

在这些合作伙伴中，有 12 家做出了回应，其中包括亚马逊(AMZN.O) 、Index Exchange 和 Pinterest (PINS.N) ，并表示他们对《愤怒的小鸟》上出现的广告不承担任何责任。

萨兰加表示，该部已向 Taboola (TBLA.O) 、Outbrain (OB.O) 、Alphabet 旗下谷歌(GOOGL.O)和 X（前身为 Twitter）等广告公司投入资金。 Taboola 和 Outbrain 表示，他们与游戏广告无关。

With dozens of Hezbollah fighters killed in three weeks of border clashes with Israel, the Lebanese group is working to stem its losses as it prepares for the possibility of a drawn-out conflict, three sources familiar with its thinking said.

The Iran-backed group has lost 47 fighters to Israeli strikes at Lebanon's frontier since its Palestinian ally Hamas and Israel went to war on Oct. 7 - about a fifth of the number killed in a full-scale war between Hezbollah and Israel in 2006.

With most of its fighters killed in Israeli drone strikes, Hezbollah has unveiled its surface-to-air missile capability for the first time, declaring on Sunday it downed an Israeli drone. The missiles are part of an increasingly potent arsenal .

The Israeli military has not commented on Sunday's reported drone incident. But Israel said on Saturday it had stopped a surface-to-air missile fired from Lebanon at one of its drones and that it responded by striking the launch site.

One of the sources familiar with Hezbollah's thinking told Reuters that the use of anti-aircraft missiles was one of several steps taken by the Shi'ite Muslim group to curb its losses and counter Israeli drones, which have picked off its fighters in the rocky terrain and olive groves along the border.

Hezbollah had made "arrangements to reduce the number of martyrs", the source said, without offering further details.

Since the onset of the Hamas-Israel war, Hezbollah's attacks have been calibrated to contain clashes to the border zone, even as it has indicated a readiness for all-out war if necessary, sources familiar with its thinking say.

Israel, which is waging a war in the Gaza Strip that it says aims to destroy Hamas, has said it has no interest in a conflict on its northern frontier with Lebanon, where it has said so far that seven of its soldiers have been killed.

"I hope we will be able to keep the quiet on this front," Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant told a briefing, adding that he believed Israel's strong defence forces and their actions in Gaza had deterred Hezbollah till now.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said Israel would unleash devastation on Lebanon if a war did start.

FORMIDABLE FORCE

Hezbollah, the most formidable Iranian ally in Tehran's "Axis of Resistance", has long said it has expanded its arsenal since 2006 and warned Israel that its forces pose a more potent threat than before. It says its armoury now includes drones and rockets that can hit all parts of Israel.

In border clashes since Oct. 7, Hamas, which also has operatives in Lebanon, and a Lebanese Sunni Islamist faction Jama'a Islamiya have both fired rockets from southern Lebanon into Israel.

Hezbollah itself has refrained from firing rockets, such as unguided Katyushas and others that can fly deep into Israeli territory, a step that could prompt an escalation.

Instead, its fighters have been firing at visible targets across the frontier with Israel, using weapons such as guided anti-tank Kornet missiles, a weapon the group used extensively in 2006, the three sources said.

Hezbollah's television channel, Al-Manar, has regularly replayed footage from the latest clashes showing what it says are strikes on Israeli military installations and positions visible across the border.

While Hezbollah's tactics so far have helped contain the conflict, the attacks mean its fighters need to be close to the frontier, which makes them more vulnerable to Israel's military.

The sources said some fighters had also underestimated the drone threat after years of combat in Syria where they had fought insurgent groups with nothing like the Israeli military's hardware. Hezbollah played a decisive role in helping President Bashar al-Assad beat back Syrian insurgents.

"The technical superiority of the Israeli drones is making Hezbollah pay the price of this number of fighters," Nabil Boumonsef, deputy editor-in-chief at Lebanon's Annahar newspaper, said, in reference to Hezbollah's hefty death toll.

CONFLICT CONTAINED SO FAR

Clashes between Israel and Hezbollah have broadly stayed contained in a narrow band of land that runs along the border, generally staying within three to four kms of the frontier.

However, Israeli shelling has expanded in recent days, according to security sources in Lebanon. They said this included a strike on Saturday on Jabal Safi, a mountainous area that lies about 25 km (15 miles) from the border.

A senior Russian Rabbi on Monday urged the Kremlin to ensure that rioters in the predominantly Muslim Dagestan region who stormed an airport to "catch" Jewish passengers on board a flight from Tel Aviv were harshly punished.

Videos obtained by Reuters from the airport at Makhachkala, the regional capital of Dagestan, showed the rioters, mostly young men, waving Palestinian flags, breaking down glass doors and running through the airport on Sunday evening shouting "Allahu Akbar" or "God is Greatest".

One group was seen trying to overturn a police patrol truck, while another video showed rioters on the tarmac surrounding a Red Wings aircraft which had arrived from Tel Aviv.

One placard brandished by rioters in an unverified social media post said: "There is no place for child killers in Dagestan."

Another said: "We are against Jewish refugees."

Shmuel, 26, an Israeli citizen and one of the passengers, told Israeli publication Ynet that police had got passengers onto a bus which was then chased around the airport by rioters.

"The bus kept turning around...and people were chasing it and throwing stones. I put my suitcase against the window," he said.

At one point, he said the passengers had been questioned by locals about their religion.

"They came inside, went from person to person, and asked if they were a Muslim or a Jew. I said I was a Muslim, because I was scared to death. Fortunately, they believed me and continued on," he said.

It was unclear in what circumstances that questioning took place with another passenger telling the Mediazona news website that a small group of locals had been shown the passengers' documents in an airport building where the passengers were being held at the time.

Rabbi Alexander Boroda, the president of Russia's Federation of Jewish Communities, called for a tough response.

In a statement, Boroda said that the riot had "undermined the basic foundations of our multi-cultural and multi-national state" and that anti-Israeli sentiment fuelled by events in the Middle East had become open aggression towards Russian Jews.

"Moreover, we see that local authorities were not prepared for such incidents and allowed large-scale violations of law and order and mass demonstrations with open threats to Jews and Israelis," Boroda said.

"I call on the country's leadership and law enforcement agencies to find and punish all the organisers and participants of these anti-Semitic actions in the strictest possible manner."

The mob converged on the airport after a message on the Telegram messaging app urged Dagestanis to meet the "uninvited guests" in "adult fashion" and to get the plane and its passengers to turn around and fly somewhere else.

The message, posted on the "Utro Dagestan" Telegram channel, did not use the word "Jew" but referred to the plane's passengers as being "unclean."

"We need to wait for them on the street outside the airport and catch them before they go their separate ways," the message said.

Telegram founder Pavel Durov said his service was banning the channel for calling for violence, something he said violated Telegram's rules and those of "the entire civilised world."

Police said they had arrested 60 people in connection with the unrest and identified 150 of the most active participants.

Israel's ambassador to Russia was cited by the RIA news agency as saying that no Israeli citizens had been hurt in the unrest and that they had all been safely evacuated amid unconfirmed reports they had been taken to a military base before being flown out of the region.

Makhachkala airport resumed normal operations on Monday afternoon, Russia's aviation authority said, but it announced that flights from Israel would temporarily be re-directed to other cities in Russia.

'WESTERN ATTEMPT TO DIVIDE RUSSIA'

The Kremlin said President Vladimir Putin would hold a meeting later on Monday to discuss how the West is trying to use the crisis in the Middle East to divide Russian society.

The unrest in Dagestan, where Russian security forces once fought an Islamist insurgency, is a headache for Putin, who is waging a war in Ukraine and is keen to maintain stability at home ahead of an expected presidential election next year.

Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said the violence was the result of "outside influence" and that "ill-wishers" had used images of suffering in Gaza to stir people up. Maria Zakharova, a spokeswoman for the Russian foreign ministry, accused Ukraine of a "direct and key role" in preparing the "provocation".

Ukrainian presidential adviser Mykhailo Podolyak told Reuters that Kyiv had "nothing to do" with the unrest.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Sunday blamed the events on what he called Russia's "widespread culture of hatred toward other nations, which is propagated by state television, pundits, and authorities".

The unrest followed several other anti-Semitic incidents in recent days in Russia's North Caucasus region in response to Israel's war against Hamas militants in Gaza. Israel has urged Russian authorities to protect Israelis and Jews in their jurisdictions.

中国国家主席习近平领导下的中央军委副主席张又侠对美国及其盟国进行了含蓄的批评，指责“一些国家”试图破坏中国政府。

但张也强调有必要改善与美国的军事关系。

张在受武官和外交官密切关注的讲话中说：“我们将深化与俄罗斯的战略合作与协调，并愿意在相互尊重、和平共处、合作共赢的基础上发展与美国的军事关系。” 。

据中国官方媒体新华社报道，张在论坛期间与绍伊古举行了会谈。

中国国防部长往年都曾在论坛上发表过主旨演讲，但李尚福上周在没有任何解释的情况下被解除国防部长职务，接替者也尚未任命。

路透社上个月报道称，失踪两个月的李正因腐败问题接受调查。

自三月份华盛顿批准的李克强上任以来，中美两国一直没有进行过高层军事交流。

“在这里聆听”

美国国防部派出由国防部副部长办公室中国国家主任辛西娅·克桑西·卡拉斯率领的代表团。

据央视旗下社交媒体账户报道，卡拉斯在论坛上与国防部发言人吴谦进行了简短交流。

美国前负责中国事务的副助理国防部长查德·斯普拉贾强调了美国参与的重要性。

斯布拉吉亚说：“对美国来说，重要的是要在这里，不要把空间让给其他人。我们在这里，我们正在倾听。”他说，他是以研究身份参加会议的。

美国代表团出席之际，正值美国总统乔·拜登和中国习近平下个月举行峰会之前，美国和中国加强了交流。

上周，中国最高外交官王毅与拜登进行了一个小时的会谈，白宫称这是在两个竞争对手之间保持开放沟通渠道的“好机会”。

尽管发表了关于改善中美军事关系的和解言论，但张和一些中国军官在台湾等问题上没有表现出软化立场，北京将台湾视为其领土。

中国中将何雷周日在一次小组会议上表示，如果中国不得不对台湾使用武力，“这将是一场争取统一的战争，一场正义合法的战争”。

张在讲话中表示，各国“不应在重大敏感问题上刻意刺激其他国家”，并补充说台湾是中国的“核心利益”。

许多西方国家要么回避这个论坛，要么只派出低级别代表团。
